body.section:
What is the Object Storage (Swift)?
Object Storage (Swift) is Software Defined Storage (SDS) architecture layered on top of industry-standard servers using native storage devices. Swift presents an object paradigm using an underlying set of disk drives. The disk drives are managed by a data structure called a "ring". You can store, retrieve, and delete objects in a container through RESTful API.Based on OpenStack Object Storage, the HP Helion OpenStack Object Storage service provides a highly available, resilient, and scalable storage pool for unstructured data. It is highly durable architecture with no single point of failure. In addition, HP Helion OpenStack introduces the concept of cloud models, where the user can modify the YAML to provide the required configuration based on their environment.

section.p: A Swift system comprises a number of services:

ul.li: Swift-Proxy provides the API for all requests to the Swift system.
Account and Container services provide storage management of the accounts and containers.
Object services provide storage management for object storage.

section.p: These services can be co-located in a number of ways. The following two general pattern exist in the example cloud models distributed in HP Helion OpenStack:

ul.li: The Swift-proxy, Account, Container, and Object services run on the same (PACO) node type in the control plane. This is used for smaller clouds or where Swift is a minor element in a larger cloud.

The Swift-Proxy, Account, and Container services run on one (PAC) node type in a control plane and the Object services run on another (OBJ) node type in a resource pool. This is used for in larger clouds or where a larger Swift system is in use or planned.

section.p: Each of these node types can be scaled independently to meet workload and redundancy requirements. The storage service can be scaled up as necessary. It can also scaled horizontally to handle an increased number of simultaneous connections and a larger number of objects.

body.p: Swift is configured through a number of YAML files in the HP Helion implementation of the OpenStack Object storage (Swift) service. For more details on the configuration of the YAML files, refer to .
